item.title: SQL Server Fabric and DATAllegro demo at PASS, SQL Data Services Public CTP Available
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Microsoft has shown DATAllegro at the PASS conference. They have removed Linux, the database it was running on and also the old file system. DATAllegro is running on Windows with NTFS and SQL2008 now. Can’t wait for the Kilimanjaro CTP üôÇ Another thing shown at PASS is SQL Server Fabric. SQL Server Fabric gives you […]
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft has shown DATAllegro at the PASS conference. They have removed Linux, the database it was running on and also the old file system. DATAllegro is running on Windows with NTFS and SQL2008 now. Can’t wait for the Kilimanjaro CTP

Another thing shown at PASS is SQL Server Fabric. SQL Server Fabric gives you the ability to manage your SQL Server environment as a whole. Inside SQL Server Management Studio there will be a new view named Fabric Explorer connecting to a Fabric Control Point. The Dashboard will show the overal health

SQL Data Services Public CTP
SQL Data Services (SDS) are highly scalable, on-demand data storage and query processing utility services. Built on robust SQL Server database and Windows Server technologies, these services are designed to provide high availability, security and support standards-based web interfaces for easy programming and quick provisioning. Currently these services are only available in pre-release beta form

Signup here: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=133905&clcid=0x409

item.title: Kilimanjaro is the code name for the next version of SQL Server
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: So after Shiloh, Sphinx, Yukon and Katmai now we have Kilimanjaro. Kilimanjaro is a mountain in Tanzania and the new codename for SQL Server 11 üôÇ [Edit]Apparently Kilimanjaro is the code name for the next version of SQL Server but this is not SQL 11 üôÅ Here is what it says in the press release […]
item.content:encoded:
So after Shiloh, Sphinx, Yukon and Katmai now we have Kilimanjaro. Kilimanjaro is a mountain in Tanzania and the new codename for SQL Server 11

[Edit]Apparently Kilimanjaro is the code name for the next version of SQL Server but this is not SQL 11

Here is what it says in the press release

Ted Kummert, corporate vice president of Microsoft‚Äôs Data and Platform Storage Division, showcased ‚ÄúKilimanjaro,‚Äù which will further enrich SQL Server‚Äôs BI capabilities while providing a robust and scalable data platform capable of supporting the largest BI deployments. ‚ÄúKilimanjaro‚Äù will include a set of new, easy-to-use analysis tools for managed self-service, project-code-named ‚ÄúGemini,‚Äù that will enable information workers to slice and dice data and create their own BI applications and assets to share and collaborate on from within the familiar, everyday Microsoft Office productivity tools they already use. Customers and partners will be able to gain early access to ‚ÄúKilimanjaro‚Äù within the next 12 months via a community technology preview (CTP) with full product availability slated for the first half of calendar year 2010. [/Edit]
